benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/bundles/{bundleId}/customFields - Modify custom fields to bundle

covered: Valid Request: Successful modification with required headers (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC13‑TC15).
Empty custom fields array to remove all fields (TC03).
Maximum allowed number of custom fields (TC13).
Special characters in custom field value (TC19).
Integration with dependent service returning inconsistent data (TC20).
State variation – bundle with no custom fields (TC22).
State variation – bundle with existing custom fields (TC23).
gaps: Partial Update Rejection: No test verifies that a partial update is rejected when the API does not support it.
Concurrency Race Condition: No test simulates two concurrent updates to the same bundle to expose race conditions.
Rate Limiting: No test verifies throttling when many requests are sent in a short period.
Caching Behavior: No test checks for ETag/Cache‑Control headers or caching semantics.
Duplicate Submission: No test ensures that duplicate PUT requests with identical payload are handled idempotently.
Large Payload Beyond Maximum: No test for payload sizes exceeding the defined maximum limit (beyond the maximum number of custom fields).
recommendations: Add a test that attempts a partial update (e.g., only one field) and expects a 400/409 if the API does not support partial updates.
Create a concurrency test where two clients update the same bundle simultaneously and verify data integrity.
Implement rate‑limiting tests that send a burst of requests and assert proper 429 responses.
Add assertions for caching headers (ETag, Cache‑Control) on successful responses.
Add a duplicate submission test to confirm the API is idempotent for identical PUT payloads.
Add a test with a payload that exceeds the maximum allowed size (e.g., > max fields or very large field values) to verify proper handling.
